decks.notes: The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Wrenn and Six, along with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix for card advantage and versatility. The mana base includes a variety of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence and card advantage.

This deck aims to quickly generate a large amount of mana through rituals and fast mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, while manipulating the top of the deck with cantrips like Preordain and Ponder. The deck then looks to assemble the combo pieces for Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize, Duress, and Cabal Ritual to help protect the combo. The key strategy is to efficiently and consistently storm off to win the game before the opponent can stop them.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of land destruction, card advantage, and versatile removal spells. By utilizing cards like Wasteland, Punishing Fire, and Liliana of the Veil, alongside the graveyard recursion provided by Life from the Loam, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating incremental advantage over time. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary provides threats that can end the game quickly if left unchecked, making it a versatile and resilient control deck.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on aggressive early-game plays with efficient, low-cost spells and creatures. Utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Young Pyromancer to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic like Force of Will and Stifle. The deck aims to quickly close out games by deploying threats that are difficult to deal with for many opponents, such as True-Name Nemesis. Additionally, the mana denial from cards like Wasteland helps to keep the opponent on the back foot and unable to stabilize.

The deck focuses on generating enormous amounts of mana through Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while using Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to untap key creatures and generate card advantage with Glimpse of Nature. The main win condition is to use Natural Order or Green Sun's Zenith to search for Craterhoof Behemoth and buff all of the elves for a lethal attack. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Reclamation Sage and Archon of Valor's Reach to control the board against opponent's strategies.

This UWx control deck focuses on disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while also using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the board. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Magmatic Sinkhole, as well as card advantage engines like Narset, Parter of Veils and Snapcaster Mage. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue opponents in a 1 vs 1 Legacy format.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Stitcher's Supplier, Careful Study, and Hedron Crab to bring back creatures like Gravecrawler, Bloodghast, and Vengevine. By sacrificing creatures with Altar of Dementia and triggering Bridge from Below, the deck can overwhelm opponents with a fast and powerful Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. Cabal Therapy helps disrupt opponents' strategies while Carrion Feeder provides a sac outlet for creatures. The deck aims to win through the graveyard synergy and combo potential of its cards.

The deck focuses on combining the control elements of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares with the engine of Life from the Loam to generate value and grind out the opponent. By utilizing cards like Wrenn and Six for recursion and utility lands like Karakas and Dark Depths to create pressure, the deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent. The engine of loam, exploration, and crop rotation allows for consistent mana development and toolbox access to key lands like Bojuka Bog and Field of the Dead. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outmaneuver the opponent with efficient planeswalkers and land synergy.

The deck focuses on quickly applying pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with countermagic and efficient threat removal. It utilizes cards like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis to establish a fast clock, while cards like Wasteland and Daze disrupt the opponent's resources. The deck also has efficient card selection with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as powerful late-game card advantage engines like Wrenn and Six. Overall, the deck aims to consistently apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible using cards like Crop Rotation and Thespian's Stage. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo and interaction spells like Abrupt Decay and Assassin's Trophy to deal with threats. The deck also includes ways to recur the combo pieces from the graveyard with cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Satyr Wayfinder. Overall, the deck aims to combo off while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently deal poison counters to the opponent's life total by using creatures with Infect. The deck includes a variety of pump spells and protection spells to ensure that the Infect creatures can get through and deal damage. The inclusion of Wrenn and Six provides additional card advantage and the ability to recur key lands. The deck also features ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Daze. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through aggressive and explosive plays using the Infect mechanic.

The main focus of this Aggro - Dragon Stompy deck is to utilize cards like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, Blood Moon, and Magus of the Moon to disrupt opponents' mana bases and prevent them from casting their spells effectively. The deck also includes aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Legion Warboss to apply pressure on opponents. Ensnaring Bridge helps to protect the player from attacks while Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Fiery Confluence provide additional removal and card advantage. The deck aims to lock down opponents and win through efficient creature beats and burn spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Auriok Salvagers and Lion's Eye Diamond combo to generate infinite mana and draw the entire deck. This is achieved by using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Bauble to filter through the deck, while also utilizing Mystic Forge to cast nonland cards from the top of the library. Monastery Mentor and Walking Ballista are used as win conditions to close out the game once the combo is assembled. Karn, the Great Creator is utilized to shutdown opposing artifacts and provide additional utility for the deck.

The key concept of this UWx Control deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of powerful counterspells and removal spells, backed up by card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells and removing threats, while also generating value through cards like Monastery Mentor and Narset, Parter of Veils. The mana base is streamlined with snow-covered lands and fetchlands to ensure consistency in casting spells and accessing all three colors of mana.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also generating card advantage through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils. Monastery Mentor provides a win condition by creating tokens, and cards like Back to Basics and Council's Judgment help to lock down the opponent's resources. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to filter through the deck and find key cards to control the game.
